data.description:
CAT IS BACK TO MAKE ANOTHER MESS! BUT THIS TIME, IT'LL BE YOUR BLOOD.

FIND ALL 6 ITEMS, THEN GO INTO THE PENTAGRAM TO BANISH CAT BACK INTO THE BOX.
CAT WILL APPEAR AFTER FINDING THE FIRST ITEM AND WILL GET FASTER THE MORE YOU FIND.
DON'T LET HIM CATCH YOU!

changelog.change_log:
Changes:

- Added a map sign so that the player actually knows where they're going.
- Changed the path's texture to be more visible, if you still get lost that's your fault.
- Added a smooth turning mode for people who somehow prefer it.
- Added a seated mode to be more accessible to people who can't stand, and people who don't want to. Although, the game is still perfectly playable without the added height.
- Moved the controls screen to a sign, located at the start of the game next to the new map sign.
- Replaced title music with a low rumble.
- Replaced the game's background sound with a low rumble.
- Replaced the player's footstep sound.
- Replaced the item's sounds to a click.
- Replaced the static when the player is close to CAT with a louder static.
- Added a static sound to the lose screen.
- Added a cheer sound to the win screen.
- Added a flashlight toggle. This doesn't have any purpose yet.
- The item's outline distance has been increased, you might see them this time.
- Renamed "Item's Collected" to "Item's Found" to be simpler.
- Added a fade between screens to increase comfort.
- Fixed height of the phone booth, now it should be able to fit an adult human inside.
- Added a cool visual effect when the player dies wins, I think you're gonna like this one ;)
- Removed the leaves from all the trees, this increased the performance by a lot.
- Limited the refresh rate of the Quest to 60hz and the Quest 2 to 75hz as this is the highest stable frame rate they can currently reach. I will continue to find fixes for performance.

Major changes:
- Added a map sign so that the player actually knows where they're going.
- Changed the path's texture to be more visible, if you still get lost that's your fault.
- Added a smooth turning mode for people who somehow prefer it.
- Added a seated mode to be more accessible to people who can't stand, and people who don't want to. Although, the game is still perfectly playable without the added height.
- Removed the leaves from all the trees, this increased the performance by a lot.

Minor changes:
- Moved the controls screen to a sign, located at the start of the game next to the new map sign.
- Replaced title music with a low rumble.
- Replaced the game's background sound with a low rumble.
- Replaced the player's footstep sound.
- Replaced the item's sounds to a click.
- Replaced the static when the player is close to CAT with a louder static.
- Added a static sound to the lose screen.
- Added a cheer sound to the win screen.
- Added a flashlight toggle. This doesn't have any purpose yet.
- The item's outline distance has been increased, you might see them this time.
- Renamed "Item's Collected" to "Item's Found" to be simpler.
- Added a fade between screens to increase comfort.
- Fixed height of the phone booth, now it should be able to fit an adult human inside.
- Added a cool visual effect when the player dies wins, I think you're gonna like this one ;).
- Limited the refresh rate of the Quest to 60hz and the Quest 2 to 75hz as this is the highest stable frame rate they can currently reach. I will continue to find fixes for performance.
